channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Covering the military parade and a No Kings rally on the same day
item.description: Frank Langfitt has covered the world. Now he reports for NPR as a roving correspondent, focusing on stories that help us understand a changing America...

item.title: Trump says U.S. 'completely and totally obliterated' nuclear facilities in Iran
item.description: The attack marks a major escalation in the burgeoning war between Iran and Israel and came despite years of promises by President Trump to keep the U....

item.title: Giant Michael Jackson statues popped up 30 years ago. Where have they gone?
item.description: The King Of Pop had 10 statues made in his image in 1995, but where can they be seen three decade later?

item.title: Trump's Iran gamble fraught with risk - at home and abroad
item.description: As well as retaliation against US troops, a president who styled himself as "peacemaker" could face party dissent.

item.title: Vietnam vets who left school for service get diplomas over six decades later
item.description: Operation Recognition is a program through the Iowa Department of Veterans Affairs that's given more than 100 veterans a chance to receive their high ...

item.title: U.S. launches strikes on 3 Iranian nuclear facilities, Trump says
item.description: The U.S. reached out to Iran diplomatically to say the strikes are all the U.S. plans and that regime change efforts are not planned, sources said.

item.title: Lawmakers respond to U.S. launching strikes on 3 Iranian nuclear facilities
item.description: Congress members offered a split response after President Trump's announcement that the U.S. had launched strikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities.

item.title: 6 dead, 2 missing after boat capsizes on Lake Tahoe during storm, Coast Guard says
item.description: Six people died and two others are missing after a 27-foot boat capsized on Lake Tahoe on Saturday afternoon, the U.S. Coast Guard said.

item.title: Nobody can stop talking about the self-styled knight giving away cars
item.description: Some are beguiled by the Zimbabwean tycoon's generosity, others alarmed about the source of his wealth.

item.title: Trump calls U.S. strikes on Iran a "spectacular military success"
item.description: President Trump announced earlier Saturday night that the U.S. had launched strikes against three Iranian nuclear sites.

item.title: Watch: Trump says strikes on Iran a 'spectacular military success' in address
item.description: The US president warns Iran of future attacks if they retaliate.

item.title: What we know about US strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities
item.description: Three nuclear facilities are reported to have been bombed, including the uranium enrichment facility at Fordo.

item.title: One daughter's search for a father detained by ICE
item.description: Francisco Urizar, 64, was detained by ICE while on his work route delivering tortillas. His daughter Nancy is trying to find out what happened to him.

item.title: At least three people dead from a tornado in North Dakota
item.description: At least three residents were killed in the Enderlin area by a tornado on Friday night after storms hit North Dakota and Minnesota.

item.title: Pilot who died in N.C. plane crash tried to avoid a turtle on airport runway
item.description: The pilot of a small plane that crashed near an airport tried to avoid hitting a turtle on the runway, according to a National Transportation Safety B...

item.title: A tornado that swept through a rural town in North Dakota left at least 3 people dead
item.description: Three people are dead and a regional airport has been heavily damaged after powerful winds including a tornado swept across the upper U.S. Midwest.

item.title: New Texas law will require Ten Commandments to be posted in every public school classroom
Man arrested after Utah ‘No Kings’ rally shooting is released as investigation continues
